reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Refreshing and Rejuvenating
reviews.reviewText: I recently tried the Amazon Basics Clarifying Pink Grapefruit Body Wash, and I am delighted to share my positive experience with this product. It has become a staple in my daily shower routine, offering a refreshing and rejuvenating bathing experience.First and foremost, the scent of this body wash is invigorating. The pink grapefruit fragrance is fresh, citrusy, and uplifting. It provides a burst of energy in the morning or a revitalizing pick-me-up after a long day. The scent lingers on the skin, leaving a subtle and pleasant aroma that lasts throughout the day.The formula of the body wash is gentle yet effective. It lathers well, creating a rich and creamy foam that cleanses the skin without stripping it of its natural moisture. The formula is non-drying, making it suitable for daily use, even for those with dry or sensitive skin. After using this body wash, my skin feels clean, soft, and nourished.I appreciate that the Amazon Basics Clarifying Pink Grapefruit Body Wash is free from harsh chemicals like parabens and sulfates. This gives me peace of mind knowing that I am using a product that is gentle on my skin and doesn't contain any potentially harmful ingredients. The body wash is also cruelty-free, which aligns with my values as a conscious consumer.The packaging of the body wash is simple and functional. The flip-top cap allows for easy dispensing and prevents any leakage or spills. The bottle itself is sturdy and recyclable, which is a bonus for those who prioritize sustainability.Considering the price point, the Amazon Basics Clarifying Pink Grapefruit Body Wash offers excellent value for money. It performs comparably to higher-end body washes but at a more affordable price. This makes it accessible to a wide range of consumers without compromising on quality.In conclusion, the Amazon Basics Clarifying Pink Grapefruit Body Wash has exceeded my expectations. Its refreshing scent, gentle formula, and affordable price make it a standout product in the body wash category. If you're looking for a body wash that invigorates the senses and leaves your skin feeling clean and nourished, I highly recommend giving this pink grapefruit body wash a try.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good value, good smell
reviews.reviewText: Package arrived and the bottle were shoved in the box that was too small and tops were broken and some contents Leaked - but this was a packaging of the shipper not the actual products fault.Overall, the product smelled like a pleasant grapefruit and did its purpose for my skin. I would recommend for its value and decent smell compared to some other brands.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Smells Really good
reviews.reviewText: So far I have been using it for 3days. My face feels refreshed using it since this is why I purchased it. It does dry you skin out so if you have oily skin I would say this is for you. If your skin is already dry I would suggest using a moisturizer after using this. I love the grapefruit smell it’s not as bad as I thought it would be. Face clearing of dark spots and pimples. I would give it a 5 but I want to see if my face clears more first. I recommend at least trying it for sure. Everyone skin is different

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Inexpensive and works well
reviews.reviewText: Costs much less than brand names and works exactly the same! Don't waste your money on more expensive products.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Very Thick and Goopy
reviews.reviewText: I don’t know whether this or good or bad, but the product is very thick and goopy. I guess that helps you not to lose it when you’re bathing, but it also seems like it wastes product. I hope somebody else will discuss this aspect of it.The scent isn’t very heavy and doesn’t stay on me after the shower, which I like. I would prefer unscented, as I use several products in the shower, and their “light scents” all clash and smell acrid when used together.I don’t feel like this really works for my purpose. I have been trying to remember to use this daily on the areas that I shave, but I don’t always remember. There’s a roll-on product that has, among other ingredients, salicylic acid, and it’s supposed to reduce razor bumps and ingrown hairs, but it’s very expensive.I had hoped this soap would be a good alternative, but it doesn’t seem to be working. However, you use that other product twice a day, and I haven’t been using this soap twice a day. So, maybe my review isn’t really fair, but this just isn’t working out for me for this purpose.
